questions.question: Explain the importance of PowerPoint in education.
questions.answer: PowerPoint is an effective tool in education as it helps teachers deliver lessons clearly and attractively. It allows the use of text, images, charts and data to explain concepts. Students can also use it to present projects, making learning interactive and engaging.

questions.question: Describe the steps to create a basic PowerPoint presentation.
questions.answer: First, open Microsoft PowerPoint. Click on File and choose 'New' to create a blank presentation. Select a design template using the Design menu. Add text in the text boxes, insert pictures using the Insert menu, resize images if needed, apply transitions, and finally start the slide show using 'From Beginning'.

questions.question: What is the use of slide design in PowerPoint?
questions.answer: Slide design helps to make presentations visually attractive. By choosing suitable colors and layouts, the presenter can highlight important information and maintain audience interest.

questions.question: Explain how to add and resize pictures in a slide.
questions.answer: Pictures can be added by clicking on Insert and selecting Pictures or by dragging and dropping. To resize, click on the picture and drag the corner handles to the desired size.

questions.question: What are transitions? Why are they used?
questions.answer: Transitions are visual effects applied between slides. They make the presentation smoother and more appealing to viewers.

questions.question: What does 'Go Live' mean in PowerPoint?
questions.answer: It means starting the slide show so that the presentation can be viewed by the audience.

questions.question: Explain the concept of a slide handout.
questions.answer: A slide handout is a summary of the slides provided to the audience. It helps them revise and understand the topic better.

questions.question: Describe the 10/20/30 rule of PowerPoint.
questions.answer: The 10/20/30 rule suggests that a presentation should have no more than 10 slides, last no longer than 20 minutes, and use a font size of at least 30 points. This makes presentations concise and effective.

questions.question: Why should presentations be kept simple?
questions.answer: Simple presentations help the audience focus on the main message and avoid confusion.

questions.question: Explain the importance of body language in presentation.
questions.answer: Positive body gestures, eye contact and smiling help the speaker connect with the audience and make the presentation more engaging.

questions.question: What is the role of a title slide?
questions.answer: The title slide introduces the topic and the presenter, setting the tone for the presentation.

questions.question: How does PowerPoint help in sharing information?
questions.answer: PowerPoint allows easy sharing of information through slides that combine text, visuals and data effectively.

questions.question: Explain different types of sentences with examples.
questions.answer: Assertive: makes a statement (I like English.). Imperative: gives command (Close the door.). Interrogative: asks a question (How are you?). Exclamatory: shows strong feeling (What a beautiful day!).

questions.question: Why are bullet points used in slides?
questions.answer: Bullet points present key ideas clearly and make content easy to read.

questions.question: How does PowerPoint improve communication skills?
questions.answer: By encouraging students to organize ideas, speak confidently and present information logically.

questions.question: What are the advantages of using pictures in presentations?
questions.answer: Pictures make slides attractive, improve understanding and maintain audience interest.

questions.question: Explain how transitions enhance presentations.
questions.answer: Transitions add smooth visual movement between slides, making presentations more dynamic and professional.

questions.question: Why is feedback important in presentations?
questions.answer: Feedback helps presenters improve their skills and understand audience response.

questions.question: What is meant by 'core message'?
questions.answer: It is the main idea or purpose of the presentation that should be clearly communicated.

questions.question: How should a presentation be concluded?
questions.answer: It should end on a positive note, summarizing key points and thanking the audience.

questions.question: What qualities make an effective presentation?
questions.answer: Clarity, simplicity, confidence, good body language and proper use of visuals.

questions.question: Why is PowerPoint useful for students?
questions.answer: It helps them organize ideas, present projects effectively and develop communication skills.

questions.question: Explain the importance of font size in presentations.
questions.answer: Using large font size improves readability and ensures the audience can easily see the content.

questions.question: How does PowerPoint support collaborative learning?
questions.answer: Students can work together on presentations, share ideas and learn as a team.

questions.question: Write an appreciation of the lesson 'Live English!'.
questions.answer: The lesson ‘Live English!’ teaches students practical skills of creating PowerPoint presentations. It explains each step clearly and provides tips for effective communication. The inclusion of sentence types and presentation rules makes the lesson informative and useful for real-life applications.
